objectives.name: Primary Efficacy Objective
objectives.text: In subjects with T2DM, Stage 2 or 3 CKD and macroalbuminuria who are receiving standard of care, to assess the efficacy of canagliflozin relative to placebo in reducing: The composite endpoint of end-stage kidney disease (ESKD), doubling of serum creatinine, and renal or cardiovascular (CV) death

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective 1
objectives.text: To assess the efficacy of canagliflozin relative to placebo in reducing: The composite endpoint of CV death and hospitalized congestive heart failure

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective 2
objectives.text: To assess the efficacy of canagliflozin relative to placebo in reducing: The composite endpoint of CV death, non-fatal myocardial infarction (MI), and non-fatal stroke (ie, 3-point major adverse cardiac event [MACE])

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective 3
objectives.text: To assess the efficacy of canagliflozin relative to placebo in reducing: Hospitalized congestive heart failure

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective 4
objectives.text: To assess the efficacy of canagliflozin relative to placebo in reducing: The renal composite endpoint of ESKD, doubling of serum creatinine, and renal death

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective 5
objectives.text: To assess the efficacy of canagliflozin relative to placebo in reducing: CV death

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective 6
objectives.text: To assess the efficacy of canagliflozin relative to placebo in reducing: All-cause death

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective 7
objectives.text: To assess the efficacy of canagliflozin relative to placebo in reducing: The CV composite endpoint of CV death, non-fatal MI, non-fatal stroke, hospitalized congestive heart failure, and hospitalized unstable angina

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 1
objectives.text: To assess the efficacy of canagliflozin relative to placebo in reducing: The composite endpoint of ESKD and renal or CV death

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 2
objectives.text: To assess the impact of canagliflozin relative to placebo on: Changes in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) over time

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 3
objectives.text: To assess the impact of canagliflozin relative to placebo on: Changes in albuminuria over time

objectives.name: Safety Objective
objectives.text: To assess the overall safety and tolerability of canagliflozin.

endpoints.name: Primary Efficacy Outcome
endpoints.text: The first occurrence of ESKD, doubling of serum creatinine, and renal or CV death.

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Outcome 1
endpoints.text: The composite endpoint of CV death and hospitalized congestive heart failure

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Outcome 2
endpoints.text: The composite endpoint of CV death, non-fatal MI, and non-fatal stroke (ie, 3-point MACE)

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Outcome 3
endpoints.text: Hospitalized congestive heart failure

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Outcome 4
endpoints.text: The renal composite endpoint of ESKD, doubling of serum creatinine and renal death

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Outcome 5
endpoints.text: CV death

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Outcome 6
endpoints.text: All-cause death

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Outcome 7
endpoints.text: The CV composite endpoint of CV death, non-fatal MI, non-fatal stroke, hospitalized congestive heart failure, and hospitalized unstable angina

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Outcome 1
endpoints.text: Reduction in the composite endpoint of ESKD and renal or CV death

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Outcome 2
endpoints.text: Changes in eGFR over time

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Outcome 3
endpoints.text: Changes in albuminuria over time

endpoints.name: Safety Outcomes
endpoints.text: The overall safety and tolerability of canagliflozin. The safety evaluations include the collection of adverse events, laboratory tests, vital signs (pulse, blood pressure), physical examination, and body weight.

estimands.name: Primary Efficacy Estimand
estimands.populationSummary: Adults (≥30 years) with T2DM, Stage 2 or 3 CKD (eGFR 30 to <90 mL/min/1.73m2), and macroalbuminuria (UACR >300 to ≤5000 mg/g) on stable ACEi or ARB therapy. Summary measure: Hazard ratio.

intercurrentEvents.name: Treatment discontinuation
intercurrentEvents.text: Premature discontinuation of study drug for any reason

intercurrentEvents.name: Death
intercurrentEvents.text: Death due to non-renal and non-CV causes

intercurrentEvents.name: Initiation of rescue medication
intercurrentEvents.text: Use of additional antihyperglycemic or antihypertensive therapies to reach clinical goals

estimands.analysisPopulation: Adults (≥30 years) with T2DM, Stage 2 or 3 CKD (eGFR 30 to <90 mL/min/1.73m2), and macroalbuminuria (UACR >300 to ≤5000 mg/g) on stable ACEi or ARB therapy.
estimands.variableOfInterest: Time from randomization to the first occurrence of ESKD, doubling of serum creatinine, and renal or CV death

estimands.name: Secondary Efficacy Estimand - MACE
estimands.populationSummary: Adults (≥30 years) with T2DM, Stage 2 or 3 CKD (eGFR 30 to <90 mL/min/1.73m2), and macroalbuminuria (UACR >300 to ≤5000 mg/g) on stable ACEi or ARB therapy. Summary measure: Hazard ratio.

intercurrentEvents.name: Treatment discontinuation
intercurrentEvents.text: Premature discontinuation of study drug for any reason

estimands.analysisPopulation: Adults (≥30 years) with T2DM, Stage 2 or 3 CKD (eGFR 30 to <90 mL/min/1.73m2), and macroalbuminuria (UACR >300 to ≤5000 mg/g) on stable ACEi or ARB therapy.
estimands.variableOfInterest: Time from randomization to the first occurrence of CV death, non-fatal MI, and non-fatal stroke

estimands.name: Exploratory Efficacy Estimand - eGFR Slope
estimands.populationSummary: Adults (≥30 years) with T2DM, Stage 2 or 3 CKD (eGFR 30 to <90 mL/min/1.73m2), and macroalbuminuria (UACR >300 to ≤5000 mg/g) on stable ACEi or ARB therapy. Summary measure: Slope difference (coefficient for treatment and time interaction).
estimands.analysisPopulation: Adults (≥30 years) with T2DM, Stage 2 or 3 CKD (eGFR 30 to <90 mL/min/1.73m2), and macroalbuminuria (UACR >300 to ≤5000 mg/g) on stable ACEi or ARB therapy.
estimands.summaryMeasure: Slope difference (coefficient for treatment and time interaction)
